speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: SCENE IV. The court.

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Enter KING RICHARD II, with BAGOT and GREEN at one door; and the DUKE OF AUMERLE at another

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: We did observe. Cousin Aumerle,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: How far brought you high Hereford on his way?

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: I brought high Hereford, if you call him so,

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: But to the next highway, and there I left him.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And say, what store of parting tears were shed?

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Faith, none for me; except the north-east wind,

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Which then blew bitterly against our faces,

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Awaked the sleeping rheum, and so by chance

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Did grace our hollow parting with a tear.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: What said our cousin when you parted with him?

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: 'Farewell:'

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: And, for my heart disdained that my tongue

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Should so profane the word, that taught me craft

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: To counterfeit oppression of such grief

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: That words seem'd buried in my sorrow's grave.

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: Marry, would the word 'farewell' have lengthen'd hours

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: And added years to his short banishment,

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: He should have had a volume of farewells;

speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
text_entry: But since it would not, he had none of me.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: He is our cousin, cousin; but 'tis doubt,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: When time shall call him home from banishment,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Whether our kinsman come to see his friends.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Ourself and Bushy, Bagot here and Green

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Observed his courtship to the common people;

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: How he did seem to dive into their hearts

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: With humble and familiar courtesy,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: What reverence he did throw away on slaves,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Wooing poor craftsmen with the craft of smiles

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And patient underbearing of his fortune,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: As 'twere to banish their affects with him.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Off goes his bonnet to an oyster-wench;

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: A brace of draymen bid God speed him well

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And had the tribute of his supple knee,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: With 'Thanks, my countrymen, my loving friends;'

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: As were our England in reversion his,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And he our subjects' next degree in hope.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Well, he is gone; and with him go these thoughts.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Now for the rebels which stand out in Ireland,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Expedient manage must be made, my liege,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Ere further leisure yield them further means

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: For their advantage and your highness' loss.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: We will ourself in person to this war:

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And, for our coffers, with too great a court

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And liberal largess, are grown somewhat light,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: We are inforced to farm our royal realm;

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: The revenue whereof shall furnish us

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: For our affairs in hand: if that come short,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Our substitutes at home shall have blank charters;

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Whereto, when they shall know what men are rich,

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: They shall subscribe them for large sums of gold

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: And send them after to supply our wants;

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: For we will make for Ireland presently.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Enter BUSHY

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Bushy, what news?

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Old John of Gaunt is grievous sick, my lord,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Suddenly taken; and hath sent post haste

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: To entreat your majesty to visit him.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Where lies he?

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: At Ely House.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Now put it, God, in the physician's mind

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: To help him to his grave immediately!

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: The lining of his coffers shall make coats

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: To deck our soldiers for these Irish wars.

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Come, gentlemen, let's all go visit him:

speaker: KING RICHARD II
text_entry: Pray God we may make haste, and come too late!

speaker: All
text_entry: Amen.

speaker: All
text_entry: Exeunt
